intro: Tragiella natalensis, commonly known as Natal Tragiella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, shrub-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds in achenes. Tragiella natalensis is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in dune environments.
